job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p>We are looking for an energetic and highly motivated Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our team. A Systems Engineer who loves automation, or a Software Developer who loves infrastructure, will be ideal for this role. The Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) will be an integral part of our Software Development team, and should have a passion for technology and open source software.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Responsibilities:&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><ul><li>Help develop and deploy tools and systems that assist the company’s Engineering, QA, and Operations team, to deliver high-quality software.&nbsp;</li><li>Work with development to help evolve our continuous delivery process.&nbsp;</li><li>Monitor and respond to alerts from technology infrastructure in order to ensure proper SLA's are met.&nbsp;</li><li>Work throughout the technology stack to design, build, and monitor solutions that allow for continued scalability.&nbsp;</li><li>Document work associated with troubleshooting, while utilizing problem solving skills&nbsp;</li><li>Remain flexible.&nbsp;</li><li>Have a strong sense of ownership for system uptime and performance.&nbsp;</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Skills and Experience:&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar field is preferred.&nbsp;</li><li>2-3 years of experience.&nbsp;</li><li>Knowledge of managing a Linux cluster environment (RHEL, CentOS).&nbsp;</li><li>Exceptional skills with one or more scripting languages (bash, Python, Perl, Ruby or similar).&nbsp;</li><li>Proven experience using configuration management tools such as Puppet or Chef.&nbsp;</li><li>Experience supporting and troubleshooting any of the following technology components (or similar): Linux container technology and orchestration tools (Docker/Origin/Kubernetes), Continuous Integration tools (Jenkins), Logging and alerting platforms (Nagios/ElasticSearch/Splunk), Web application servers (Apache/Tomcat/Nginx), Databases in a distributed data center environment (MySQL/Couchbase, LDAP and Kerberos.&nbsp;</li><li>Detail oriented individual, with strong communication skills used to collaborate and keep others informed.&nbsp;</li><li>Ability to produce results while working independently, and in a team environment.&nbsp;</li><li>Working knowledge of building and maintaining IP-based networks (Cisco) and F5 LTM, DNS and/or iRule development experience&nbsp;</li><li>Experience with VMWare/vCenter or AWS is preferred, but not required&nbsp;</li></ul><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;</p>
